;Recently, two counties in Bazhong, Sichuan have banned citizens from smoking bacon privately and required them to smoke bacon at designated centralized smoking points. Officials The response was to prevent air pollution. To ban a traditional food preparation method and folk custom that has lasted for more than a thousand years on the grounds of environmental protection is to ignore the traditional rights of the people and is even suspected of rent-seeking.

;

;Tongjiang and Nanjiang counties in Bazhong, Sichuan, have recently issued notices prohibiting self-smoking of pickled products in urban areas. Those who need to smoke must go to designated centralized smoking points for smoking. Violators may be fined. There is a service charge for curing bacon at centralized smoking sites, and of the two centralized smoking sites announced in Tongjiang County, one clearly states that it only smokes meat products purchased from the company. The officially designated centralized smoking point is suspected of administrative monopoly and profit transfer, which has attracted great attention on the Internet.

;

;On November 23, the Tongjiang County Comprehensive Law Enforcement Bureau responded that smoking bacon during the winter festival is a local custom, but the smoke produced during smoking seriously affects the ambient air quality. In order to improve the urban ambient air quality, Eliminate safety hazards and therefore set up centralized smoking points. The response also stated that the statement in the original notice that a centralized smoking site only smoked meat products purchased from the company reflected lax control and work errors. After consultation with the company, the smoking site was opened to the public. Staff of the Nanjiang County Comprehensive Law Enforcement Bureau also told the media that they have paid attention to the online discussion, and leaders are meeting to study it, and the results will be announced to the public.

;

;Not only Tongjiang and Nanjiang counties, but also Bazhou District, Jingkai District, Enyang District and other places in Bazhong City have also previously designated 10 bacon smoking sites. In October, due to the frequent occurrence of bacon smoking, which resulted in insufficient performance of air pollution prevention and control work, four local sub-district office principals were interviewed and reported to the whole district.

;

;Bacon has a long history. Legend has it that bacon was available during the battle between Huangdi and Chi You, and there are records of bacon in classics such as "The Book of Changes", "The Analects of Confucius" and "Book of Rites". Sichuan smoked bacon also has a history of one or two thousand years. Originally, bacon was made to extend the preservation time of meat, but now, bacon has become an important folk custom. For many Sichuan people, bacon is the taste of home and the New Year.

;

;Many places in Sichuan have their own signature bacon products, such as Qingchengshan bacon, Guangyuan Qingchuan bacon, Liangshan Mianning bacon, Beichuan bacon, and Dazhou bacon, all of which are famous local specialties. In 2013, the former Ministry of Agriculture approved the implementation of agricultural product geographical indication protection for “Wanyuan Old Bacon” in Dazhou, Sichuan. However, as efforts to control smog intensify, many places in Sichuan have banned the traditional method of smoking bacon, and many local specialty products are facing the dilemma of disappearing.

;

;Smoking bacon is a custom that has been passed down for thousands of years, but now it has to be stopped because of "polluting the air". Is this reasonable? Even if smoked bacon does cause air pollution, but people tolerate it, is it necessary for the government to ban it across the board?

;

;How much impact smoked bacon has on air quality requires scientific evaluation. Did smoking bacon bring down the air quality of the entire city? Or is there actually another more important factor in air pollution, and bacon is just a scapegoat?

;

;In addition, how much pollution can centralized smoking reduce compared with private smoking? According to the official statement, dedicated smokehouses have been built at centralized smoking sites and are equipped with corresponding environmental protection equipment to reduce pollution. So, how much pollution can centralized smoking reduce? Do environmentally friendly equipment really work?

;

;Also, just banning self-smoked meat in urban areas, how much impact can it have on environmental protection? In the county, many people's hometowns are in the countryside. If fumigation is not allowed in the city, then go back to your hometown and the countryside to smoke. Wouldn't it also cause pollution?

;

;The mandatory centralized smoking and the charging of service fees will undoubtedly increase the cost of smoked meat for citizens. Although officials say that centralized smoking points only charge cost fees, because centralized smoking points are designated and there is no market competition at all, the owners of centralized smoking points will inevitably tend to charge more. In the process of formulating smoking sites, whether there is rent-seeking or not is also a matter of public concern.

;

;If the traditional method of smoking bacon is indeed seriously polluted, it is not impossible to properly manage it. However, management does not prohibit self-smoking meat across the board, nor can smoking points be determined in a designated way. In fact, not only large-scale smoking companies can build special smokehouses and add environmental protection facilities such as smoke filtration to reduce pollution, but small smokeless and environmentally friendly bacon smoking machines have also been available for a long time. As early as 2018, a smokeless and environmentally friendly bacon smoking machine appeared in Chongqing.

;

;According to testing by the Chongqing Ecological Environment Testing Center, using this environmentally friendly smoker, the concentration of particulate matter in the air has been reduced from 400 to 500 mg per cubic meter in traditional open smokers to about 3 mg. It has been reduced from 40 mg per cubic meter to about 0.6 mg. Such a small smoking machine only sells for 20,000 to 30,000 yuan, and ordinary merchants can buy it to smoke bacon for customers. It is even possible for someone to buy one by themselves or in partnership. Although the smoking machine requires a certain cost, the sealed machine can reduce the spread of smoke and reduce the use of wood to a certain extent. Taken together, it is not much more expensive than the traditional open smoking method.

;

;In 2015, Chongqing City also banned citizens from smoking bacon in the name of environmental protection, which also caused a lot of controversy. After the successful development of a smokeless and environmentally friendly smoking machine, citizens' demand for smoked bacon has been met, and air pollution has been greatly reduced, getting the best of both worlds.

;

;At present, environmental protection is a very important task of the government. However, environmental protection should not come at the expense of public convenience and traditional customs. In the past, some places banned the burning of coal for heating in rural areas in winter, and instead used natural gas or electricity for heating. But even with government subsidies, the cost of heating is still much higher than burning coal, and farmers are overwhelmed. In some places, farmers have even been stripped of their firewood stoves and are not allowed to burn firewood, only gas. In some places, people are prohibited from burning paper money during sacrifices, and it is prohibited to burn paper houses, paper horses and other traditional funeral objects. These have caused great controversy.

;

;The environmental protection government has KPIs, but they cannot override folk customs and people's livelihood. After all, talents are the measure of all things. The government's environmental policies and measures must fully consider the lives of ordinary people and should not grossly interfere with people's living habits and interrupt thousands of years of traditional folk customs.

;On January 18, 2023, villagers in Shiyi Village, Mianyang, Sichuan There are more than 2,000 kilograms of sausages and bacon hanging in the house, and the aroma of bacon is fragrant to welcome the New Year. Pictures and texts are irrelevant. Visual China

;

;On November 15, 2023, Tongjiang County, Bazhong City, Sichuan Province issued a notice stating that private smoking of cured products, smoked bacon, sausages, etc. is prohibited in the urban area. It needs to be sent to two designated centralized smoking points. On the evening of November 23, the Tongjiang County Comprehensive Administrative Law Enforcement Bureau issued an apology announcement.

;

;However, the apology only addressed the statement in the notice that "smoking is limited to meat products purchased from the company" and did not revoke the regulations prohibiting residents from smoking meat privately.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters found that the practice of "smoking bacon at designated points to prevent air pollution" has been practiced in some areas of Sichuan for many years, and the necessity and effectiveness have been controversial. The announcement of the passage of the river has attracted attention, partly because the centralized smoking points designated by the government are also associated with enterprises.

;

;"Their charging standards are not low." Qian An is from Tongjiang County and is engaged in information self-media work there. He learned from the government that these two companies were local investment projects.

;

;The price of bacon was questioned

;

;The first announcement that caused controversy was released on November 15. The announcement stated that with the arrival of the peak season for smoking wax products, the smoke and dust produced by smoking will pollute the air and pose fire safety risks. In order to respect tradition and facilitate citizens, while protecting the ecological environment and ensuring the safety of smoking, it will be prohibited to sell smoked products in farmers’ markets, county towns, Cured products are smoked in non-designated places such as courtyards, corridors, balconies, roofs, and beside rock slopes, roadsides, river ditches, etc. It is prohibited to build cured products smoking facilities without authorization in the county. Cured products in the county are smoked at designated locations.

;

;The announcement lists the addresses and contact information of two designated smoking sites. Among them, the second smoking site specifically states that “smoking is limited to the company (Bashan Mu). meat products purchased by the industry).

;

;"It's too far." After receiving the news about the ban on privately smoked meat, a resident of Tongjiang County's first reaction was that it was inconvenient because there was something wrong with him at home. The elderly and children need to be taken care of. If you are running back and forth specifically to smoke bacon, you won't have time to take care of it. Later, he noticed that one of the centralized smoking sites did not allow bringing in meat. He believed that there was suspicion of bundled sales and forced sales.

;

;"The statement in the original notice that 'smoking is limited to meat products purchased from this company' reflects our lax control and mistakes in our work." On November 23 In its apology announcement on the 2nd, the Tongjiang County Comprehensive Administrative Law Enforcement Bureau revised this regulation, saying that after consultation with the company, the smoked site will be opened to the public at the same time. The announcement also explained that centralized smoking points are located outside the smoking control area and are equipped with spraying, filtration and other related environmental protection equipment, and cost fees are charged.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters called the contact numbers of the two centralized smoking sites announced in the notice to inquire about the charging standards, but received no reply. According to CCTV, the prices at the first centralized smoking point are divided into two types. If you bring your own marinated meat, it will be charged at about 1.6 yuan to 2 yuan per catty; if you need to pickle it, it will be charged at about 4 yuan per catty. Charge.

;

;Qian An learned that the processing fee for smoked bacon from Bashan Animal Husbandry is 3.5 yuan per catty, and the packaging fee is additional. "Smoking alone costs 3.5 yuan per catty. A pig sometimes has two to three hundred catties of meat. If you smoke it once, it will cost nearly a thousand yuan. It is quite expensive."

;

;Tongjiang County has a permanent population of about 500,000, of which the county population is about 200,000. In response to residents’ complaints that the designated smoking point is far away, the apology announcement mentioned that the first centralized smoking point has five convenience collection points.

;

;;

;

;Smoked bacon is a folk custom in winter. Visual China

;

;“We want to support our enterprises”

;

;According to the announcement from Tongjiang County, the first centralized smoking point is located in Bizhou The first community in Chengdong Village, sub-district, covers an area of ​​2,000 square meters. It has a smokehouse, management room, oil fume purification equipment and related supporting facilities. The construction area is about 600 square meters. The daily smoked wax products volume is about 5,000 kilograms. The construction has been completed. , the equipment is being debugged and will be put into use on November 25.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters checked the industrial and commercial information and found that the mobile phone number left at the smoking site was the registered phone number of Jinyu Building Materials Business Department of Damian Street Office in Longquanyi District. The company was registered in Chengdu and its main businesses are building materials and hardware.

;

;"We are a company, and bacon is one of our businesses." On November 24, a reporter from Southern Weekend called the number, and the other party replied that the smoking point had just opened It has been built but has not yet been fully put into use. In terms of its scale, it can meet the requirements of nearby residents; they provide door-to-door collection services, and residents can also go there on their own with the meat.

;

;"Many people called me and scolded me. I was really scared." The person in charge of the company said that in recent days, he had suffered Violence on the Internet has caused great trouble to oneself. "They (netizens) may have some misunderstanding. Another company said that you have to buy their meat before it can be smoked, right?"

;

;Another thing in the notice A centralized smoking point is located next to Gaokeng Power Station in Chunzai Industrial Park. It is a self-built wax products smoking point for Bazhong City Bashan Animal Husbandry Co., Ltd. (referred to as Bashan Animal Husbandry), with a daily smoked wax product volume of about 2,000 kilograms.

;

;Bashan Animal Husbandry is a leading local agricultural and animal husbandry enterprise and has been listed on the New Third Board. According to the company's official website, Bashan Animal Husbandry was established in May 2011 and is headquartered in Tongjiang County Industrial Park. It specializes in Qingyu pig breeding and the development of the entire industry chain. Cold chain logistics, marketing, and brand creation create whole-industry chain standards and systems.

;

;Why are these two companies designated to smoke meat for residents? Qian An consulted the Tongjiang County Comprehensive Administrative Law Enforcement Bureau and provided the recording to Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Qian An said that the Tongjiang County Comprehensive Administrative Law Enforcement Bureau responded that the designated smoking point is a government investment promotion project and an investment promotion enterprise. "(Bashan Animal Husbandry) is an enterprise that has made outstanding contributions to local economic development. From an emotional point of view, our local government also wants to support our local enterprises, but now it is difficult for enterprises to develop." In the recording, a member of the bureau the staff said.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters did not find the public bidding information for setting up centralized smoking points in Tongjiang County; they called the reporting hotline on the notice and Tongjiang County’s comprehensive administrative law enforcement multiple times None of the office calls were answered.

;

;Smoked bacon is a tradition in the Sichuan and Chongqing regions with a history of more than 2,000 years. In recent years, it has faced questions about air pollution. As early as 2015, after the Environmental Protection Bureau of Dazhou, Sichuan stated that "smoked bacon is the main cause of poor air quality," the local government set up centralized smoking points in the central city. At that time, the media explained that centralized smoking did not replace the widespread smoke from cooking with concentrated pollution. Its biggest advantage was that it made it easier for the government to identify problems and standardize management.

;

;Che Zhenming, a professor at the School of Food and Bioengineering at Xihua University, believes that family-style, small-scale, and small-scale smoked bacon will not have much impact on the environment. . He told CCTV that because the air is flowing, especially in a city like Bazhong, which is not densely populated, even if some pollution occurs, it will dissipate quickly. However, if smoked bacon is carried out industrially and on a large scale, its impact on the prevention and control of air pollution needs to be taken seriously.

;Recently, it was exposed that Henan Zhoukou China Unicom Company fired engineers who did not complete marketing tasks and forced users to replace optical modems, causing extensive attention. Zhoukou China Unicom stated that provincial and municipal companies have set up special work teams to investigate.

;

;According to a report on the Henan TV Metropolis Channel program, a fired China Unicom engineer revealed to the program that in order to force users to replace optical modems, Zhoukou China Unicom Company would first stop users’ broadband accounts in the background, and then come to visit engineers. They will falsely claim that "the optical modem is damaged" and require the user to replace the device, charging 299 yuan. After replacing the optical modem, restore user network services from the background. This China Unicom engineer said that when installing computers for new users, China Unicom Zhoukou Company will also use the old optical modems replaced by other users to install computers for the new users. After the new users have used them for a period of time, the engineers will come to the door and tell them that the optical modem model is too old. "No longer matches", the user will be asked to reinstall Sunbeam Cat. The engineer also said that starting from June 2023, Zhoukou China Unicom requires each engineer to complete terminal replacement tasks for 10 households per month. Because he failed to complete the task, the company unilaterally terminated the labor contract without any compensation.

;

;It seems that this engineer chose to reveal the "shady story" of China Unicom because he was dissatisfied with being fired. This incident involves two different issues. One is a labor contract dispute. Whether it is reasonable to assign marketing tasks to technical staff, and whether it is legal to dismiss employees because they cannot complete the tasks, this issue can be resolved through the labor dispute resolution mechanism, resorting to labor arbitration or the court. Regardless of whether the engineer is a regular employee who has directly signed a labor contract with China Unicom, or is dispatched to China Unicom through a labor dispatch company, his legitimate rights and interests should be safeguarded.

;

;Another question, which is more related to the public interest, is whether China Unicom has used technical means to force users to replace optical modems. If this question is true, it is very bad and suspected of fraud.

;

;According to the fired engineer’s revelations, in order to force users to replace optical modems, China Unicom Zhoukou would first stop users’ broadband in the background, preventing users from accessing the Internet, creating the illusion of a network failure. After the user reported the problem, they lied that the optical modem was broken and asked the user to pay for a new optical modem. After the replacement, the broadband was restored. It looked like the fault was repaired after the optical modem was replaced. For new users, they will deliberately use the old optical modem during installation. After a period of time, they will ask the user to replace it with a new one on the grounds that the optical modem does not match. Otherwise, they will not be able to access the Internet normally.

;

;This is undoubtedly a serious accusation. Compared with ordinary users, operators have absolute technological and information advantages. When broadband fails, ordinary users have no way of knowing the specific cause and can only rely on operators. It is very bad if operators rely on information advantages to defraud users, charge users, or achieve other goals. The deputy director of the office of Zhoukou China Unicom said that if you disconnect the Internet privately, induce users to change terminals, and maliciously charge fees, it is an illegal operation.

;

;If this matter is true, I am afraid it is not just a violation of regulations. First of all, this violates the service contract with the user and is a breach of contract. Users sign a broadband service contract with a telecom operator, and the operator is obliged to do its best to provide stable and up-to-standard broadband communication services. If a fault occurs, it should be repaired as soon as possible. If there is no fault in the first place, using technical means to create the illusion of a fault in order to achieve one's own goals, which prevents users from accessing the Internet smoothly, is undoubtedly a serious malicious act and is a fraudulent act. In addition, users are also charged a fee for exchanging bare cats. Although the amount per household is not much, the more users there are, the more the total amount is. Using fraudulent means to defraud others of property may constitute a crime of fraud if certain standards are met.

;

;Of course, whether this allegation is true remains to be investigated by the relevant departments. Nowadays, the communication control system in the operator's backend is very complete, and every operation will be recorded in the log, so it is not difficult to find out.

;

;According to media reports, there are indeed complaints about "forced replacement of optical modems" on the consumer complaint platform, and some of them directly name the Unicom branch in Henan Province. Some netizens who claim to be veteran employees in the communications industry said that this kind of behavior is the default "hidden rule" in the industry. If customers insist on not changing terminals, the company will reduce the Internet speed. In fact, this behavior not only exists among telecom operators, but also among Internet companies. An Internet giant that provides email services once "interfered" with users who used other email clients to receive their own emails, making them more likely to receive garbled emails in order to induce users to download and use their own email clients. This has even been regarded as a successful marketing case.

;

;No matter what the reason is, telecom operators want users to update their optical modems and other communication equipment. They should use incentives to attract users to voluntarily update. For example, users who replace optical modems can be upgraded to a higher network for free. Wait. It is difficult to achieve goals by setting KPI indicators for engineers. If the pressure to complete the indicators is too great, engineers may "find another way" to complete the task through non-compliant means, harming the interests of consumers. Some telecom operators have been exposed to malicious "competition" methods such as deliberately cutting off competitors' optical fibers.

;

;No matter how fierce the market competition is, work tasks should not be completed in a way that harms the interests of consumers. In response to the Zhoukou Unicom incident, the Henan Provincial Communications Administration Bureau has intervened in the investigation and conducted the first interview with Zhoukou Unicom. The management department should find out the relevant situation as soon as possible. If the situation in the revelations does exist, China Unicom should be severely punished to safeguard the interests of consumers and prevent operators from defrauding consumers by relying on asymmetric information and technological advantages.

; Sun, 26 Nov 2023 20:25:03 +0800 监督“八小时之外”：红黄橙三色如何管住干部http://www.infzm.com/contents/261351

;

;On September 12, 2023, the website of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the State Supervision Commission published an article entitled "Eight Hours" "Except", we must also take care of it! "Article. (Photo source: "China Discipline Inspection and Supervision News")

;

;The three colors of red, yellow and orange have another use. In Wucheng District, Jinhua City, Zhejiang Province, they have become a way to supervise cadres "eight hours away" means.

;

;In May 2023, a department-level cadre in Wucheng District was assigned a "red code" for management because he made mistakes in his life style. The cadre had an inappropriate relationship with others and was later reported by his family.

;

;Qian Hong, director of the Cadre Supervision Office of the Wucheng District Party Committee Organization Department, said that the cadre was transferred from his original post after the incident and his position was demoted from a principal position to a deputy position. Its file information has been given a "red code" in the cadre supervision and management system and has become a key supervision object. Unless the "red code" in the system is lifted, the cadre's rank and position cannot be promoted.

;

;This mechanism is the "red, yellow and orange three-color management" system, which is an important part of Wucheng District's eight-hour supervision and management method for leading cadres.

;

;Since 2015, starting with Guangdong Province, many places have issued opinions on the supervision and management of "eight-hour outing" activities of leading cadres, and some government agencies have also formulated implementation plans. On September 12, 2023, the website of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the State Supervisory Commission published an article titled "Beyond Eight Hours," We Must Control It! " article emphasized the importance of supervising leading cadres' "eight hours away activities". Six days later, another article was published titled "Refined and practical supervision and management to ensure the "eight hours away"".

;

;In the view of Peng Xinlin, director of the International Anti-Corruption Education and Research Center of Beijing Normal University, this is an important means to strengthen the construction of party style and clean government and the fight against corruption.

;

;3 circles, 21 items not allowed

;

;In 2023, two cadres in Wucheng District were coded for "drinking" manage.

;

;A cadre of the Discipline Inspection Commission went home from work and drank alcohol during the working day, and was discovered by the disciplinary inspection and supervision department during a temporary inspection. Because he violated the rule of "no drinking during working days", he was reminded to talk and given a "yellow code".

;

;Another cadre got into an argument with someone in the community after drinking, and the other party called the police. Because his behavior damaged the image of party members and cadres, he was admonished and given an "orange code."

;

;Specifically, during the eight-hour supervision process, "red codes" were assigned to cadres who had caused serious consequences or were suspected of violating laws and disciplines; "yellow codes" were assigned to cadres with symptoms and tendencies. cadres; those involved in minor disciplinary violations will be assigned an "orange code." According to the color of the code, cadres will be transferred to the Discipline Inspection Commission, reminded to speak, and letters of advice and admonitions will be dealt with to varying degrees.

;

; "The inspiration for this mechanism is actually traffic lights, which were first used in village cadre management." Qian Hong said that there is a "three-color management" interface in the local organization department cadre supervision and management system, which can be viewed The situation of assigned cadres.

;

;As for what behaviors cadres are not allowed to do outside of eight hours, the "Measures for the Supervision and Management of "Eight Hours Outside" Activities of Leading Cadres of Wucheng District, Jinhua City are listed in detail. This management method is governed by the District Commission for Discipline Inspection and the District Jointly issued by the Organization Department of the Committee.

;

;There are 21 prohibited behaviors, which are divided into social circle, life circle and rest circle. Each circle has 7 items.

;

;Behaviors that are not allowed in social circles include not adhering to party principles and making irresponsible remarks on the central government's policies; forming cliques and forming "small circles" through activities such as sororities, fellows' associations, classmates' associations, comrades-in-arms associations, etc., or There is no distinction between relatives and pure people, and there is collusion between officials and businessmen.

;

;The first prohibited behavior in the life circle is to condone and acquiesce in spouses, children and children's spouses violating regulations to run businesses and engage in profit-making activities. The behavior of having improper sexual relations with others is on the same level as blind comparison and pursuit of vulgar taste. In addition, violating family ethics and failing to respect and support parents are not allowed.

;

;Eating and drinking with public funds, traveling with public funds, entertainment with public funds, and using public cars for private use are not allowed in the leisure circle. In the leisure circle, another thing that is not allowed is using one's authority to act as a protective umbrella for illegal activities or evil forces.

;

;The extent to which a specific behavior is serious enough to be "coded" must be determined based on the actual situation.

;

;Qian Hong used "participating in a banquet for management service recipients" as an example. If the banquet for management service recipients is not reported, at least a yellow code must be assigned; if the meal money is paid by the management service recipient, that is Orange code; if you use your authority to provide some economic convenience to the other party during this period, a warning or a serious warning or above will be given, a red code will be assigned.    

;

;In Qian Hong’s view, no matter what kind of coding mechanism is essentially not a punishment system, but a cadre management system, “It’s not that cadres who committed crimes in the past There is no punishment system for mistakes, but instead of just settling the matter, problem cadres are managed as key targets to make the management of party members and cadres more standardized."

;

;Qian Hong also noticed that there are "eight problems" within the system There are concerns that supervision after hours may infringe on personal privacy and affect normal interpersonal interactions.”

;

;"When we issued the document, we explained to everyone that the supervision of the "eight-hour outing" activities of leading cadres will protect personal privacy within the scope of the law and will not affect their legitimate interpersonal interactions and spare time life. For example, having a meal with family and friends or going out to play, situations like this are not within the scope of our supervision." Qian Hong told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;From advocacy to implementation

;

;After the implementation of the coding system, one day in August 2023, Qian Hong received an "angry "Ms.

;

;She went to report her husband, a department-level cadre in a township in Wucheng District. The couple were both over fifty years old. She had previously suspected that her husband had inappropriate relationships with other women, but she had no evidence. This time she checked her husband's mobile phone while he was sleeping and confirmed the fact that her husband had cheated on her through chat records and transfer records.

;

;Qian Hong asked her why she went to the organization department to report first. Her answer was that in July 2023, the Wucheng District Party Committee Organization Department took the lead in launching a "double advancement" campaign, and she knew that she could go to the Organization Department if she had any opinions.

;

; "Double entry" means that in order to fully understand and grasp the "eight hours away" situation of party members and cadres, the District Party Committee Organization Department extends the supervision and management of cadres from "unit compounds" to "community courtyards" and "families" backyard".

;

;In fact, "the concept of 'eight-hour supervision' was first mentioned by local leaders 20 years ago, and later gradually became a popular saying." Zhuang Deshui, deputy director of the Integrity Construction Research Center of Peking University, introduced that in the early days , this concept appeared more in the speeches and reports of some leaders. Later, some places introduced some relevant bans and regulations, but most of them were advocacy and lacked specific implementation agencies.

;

;Public information shows that around 2001, the Organization Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China launched a pilot study of cadres’ living circles and social circles in Huzhou, Zhejiang. In 2004, the Organization Department of the Zhejiang Provincial Party Committee formulated and issued the "Opinions on Implementing the Inspection of the Living and Social Circles of Leading Cadres", which stipulated that officials' mahjong and gambling in their spare time, neighborhood relations, and the composition of their friend circles would all be included in the inspection.

;

;Guangdong Province was the first place to elevate "eight-hour supervision" to the level of rules and regulations.

;

;In February 2014, after the Eighth Inspection Team of the Central Committee inspected Guangdong, it was recommended to strengthen the daily management of party members and leading cadres and the supervision of activities "outside eight hours". In August 2015, the Guangdong Provincial Commission for Discipline Inspection, the Organization Department of the Provincial Party Committee, and the Provincial Department of Human Resources and Social Security jointly issued the "Opinions on Strengthening the Supervision and Management of "Beyond Eight Hours" Activities of Party Members and Leading Cadres". , supervision mechanisms are clearly stipulated.

;

;Subsequently, Guangdong selected 147 pilot units across the province, including Yantian District of Shenzhen, to explore and trial the supervision and management of activities of leading cadres "outside eight hours".

;

;In 2017, the then Secretary of the Yantian District Committee of Shenzhen City wrote an article in the "Study Times" introducing that Yantian District established a list of (negative) reports on "three circles" issues, community supervision, contact with cadres' families, and eight A series of supervision mechanisms such as linking extra-hour activities with selection and appointment, and integrity assessment.

;

;Public information shows that in the past six years, including Wucheng District of Jinhua City, Zhejiang Province, Pinghu City, Zhejiang Province (a county-level city under the jurisdiction of Jiaxing City), Fengxin County, Jiangxi Province, Zhijiang City, Hubei Province, and Qixian County, Henan Province , Youxian District of Mianyang City in Sichuan Province, Jianning County of Fujian Province and other places formulated the "Eight-hour Oversight Supervision Implementation Measures for Leading Cadres". The specific content also has many similarities with the relevant mechanisms in Yantian District.

;

;Pinghu City's "system for contacting cadres' families" is mainly responsible for the Cadre Supervision Office of the Organization Department of the Pinghu Municipal Party Committee. "We are used to calling it a 'home visit', during which we will focus on listening to some indicative and tendentious content." ." said Gan Keyi, deputy director of the Cadre Supervision Office.

;

;As soon as Gan Ke remembered, during a "home visit", a family member complained that his "other half" rarely ate at home from Monday to Friday, and the home visit team asked him if he ate at work. The cadre said that sometimes he worked overtime and sometimes he went out to socialize. The home visiting team then asked about the specific entertainment.

;

;"In response to this situation, we will verify through multiple channels. If we find that some entertainment may affect the performance of our duties, we will take further measures." Gan Keyi introduced that after verification by the Organization Department , and did not find that the cadre's entertainment affected his performance of duties, he had a separate conversation with him and did not make any other treatment.

;

;Mobilizing community forces to supervise the activities of cadres outside eight hours is also a method commonly adopted in various places.

;

;Pinghu City has set up three categories of "eight-hour outside supervision and observation points": Category A is located in municipal agencies and departments, Category B is located in townships and streets, and Category C is located in communities and village-level units.

;

;According to Gan Keyi, about 90% of the leading cadres in Pinghu City live in the main urban area. They have set up two community supervisors in each of the 21 communities where cadres live relatively densely. Generally, they are led by highly respected local officials. , social figures with high political quality.

;

; "Community supervisors play the role of information collectors. They only need to collect and feedback information. As for the authenticity of the information, the basic verification work is the responsibility of the B-type supervision point." Gan Keyi said, related After the implementation of the mechanism, a supervisor reported to the town street supervision point that a cadre living in the community caused a neighborhood dispute due to illegal stacking of debris in the corridor. Finally, it was verified and confirmed by the town street supervision point, and the organization department gave a reminder.

;

;A deputy division-level cadre from a northwest province expressed his recognition of the community supervision mechanism to Southern Weekend reporters, "If it can be truly implemented, it should still be very effective."

; < p>;In his opinion, community security guards can also consider hiring community supervisors. "Although they may not necessarily live in the community, they have no clue which leader comes back after drinking too much every day."

;

;"One vote veto"

;

;In the process of exploring the "eight-hour out-of-hours" supervision of leading cadres, in order to ensure the effectiveness of supervision, supervisory departments in many places will combine the "eight-hour out-of-hours" supervision situation with the selection and appointment of cadres, The unit leadership team is linked to accountability for performance of duties and unit assessment.

;

;The relevant implementation measures issued by Youxian District of Mianyang City, Sichuan in 2020 require that the personal "eight hours" of party members and cadres and their performance of supervision and management responsibilities shall be used as the basis for cadre selection and appointment, rank promotion, and performance appraisal. An important part of the evaluation and annual assessment.

;

;Wucheng District of Jinhua City also has similar regulations. Qian Hong introduced that the connection between the results of eight-hour supervision and party disciplinary sanctions will directly affect the promotion of leading cadres.

;

;Qian Hong gave an example: Those who have been severely warned within the party shall not be promoted within one and a half years, those who have been warned by the party must not be promoted within one year, and those who have been warned and spoken shall not be promoted within six months. In addition, the results of party discipline will also affect the year-end bonus of cadres to varying degrees. Once they are severely warned, the bonus will be reset to zero.

;

;In the implementation measures of various places, intra-party supervision is the primary supervision method. Party committees at all levels have the main responsibility for the supervision and management of party members and cadres in their respective regions, systems, and units "outside eight hours". The party committee secretary He is the first person responsible for holding accountable the leadership team and cadres who fail to perform their duties.

;

;Gan Keyi told a case: a cadre of a unit in Pinghu City was included in the "red list" due to a problem eight hours away. Due to issues such as insufficient timely collection of after-hours supervision information and insufficient reminders to the unit's cadres, the organization's officers were also admonished and included in the "yellow list."

;

;The "red and yellow list" is similar to the coding mechanism in Wucheng District. Being included in the "red list" means that the cadre has been investigated and investigated by the Commission for Discipline Inspection and Supervision, while the "yellow list" shows that the cadre is suspected of committing crimes. There are many tendency issues, and the organization department needs to intervene early to understand the situation.

;

;“We can’t wait until the Discipline Inspection Commission has opened a case for investigation and the public security has notified us before reporting.” Qian Hong said that the unit’s party group failed to fulfill its main responsibilities, and eventually something went wrong. The assessment of the unit’s party style and clean government construction will be affected.

;

;"In terms of cadre supervision, when it comes to issues related to integrity, self-discipline and life style, we will deduct points very severely, which is almost equivalent to a veto. If a member of the leadership team of this unit has made a mistake this year, If there is a problem, we will push it to the last level." Qian Hong told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;However, there is no clear explanation in the relevant measures from various places on how to measure the effect of eight-hour supervision.

;

;Gan Keyi said frankly that at present, to measure the effectiveness of supervision outside eight hours, it still depends on whether leading cadres can regulate themselves outside eight hours.

;

; "Eight-hour supervision is not to deal with cadres, but to protect cadres, prevent small problems from turning into big problems, and nip big problems in their bud." Gan Keyi said.

;

;At the same time, the supervision of "top leaders" has always been a difficulty in anti-corruption. "China Discipline Inspection and Supervision News" pointed out in an article analyzing "How to manage 'eight hours away'?" that the supervision of top leaders is often due to the fact that superior supervision is too far away, peer supervision is too soft, and subordinate supervision is too difficult. Facing the dilemma of ineffective supervision.

;

;"That's true. This aspect is a little more difficult. In the end, superiors are in charge of subordinates." Qian Hong said frankly. Gan Keyi also discovered that compared with supervising ordinary cadres, there are some particularities in how to supervise the activities of "top leaders" outside eight hours. "From a social perspective, the 'top leaders' will involve communication with some merchants and brother units. Sometimes they participate in some entertainment. In this process, it is indeed difficult to distinguish whether the entertainment is for business or private."

;

;"It is often possible for them to supervise others, but it is more difficult for them to accept supervision themselves. It’s difficult.” Zhuang Deshui recalled that a cadre once expressed a “relatively pessimistic” attitude to him, believing that supervision eight hours away was useless. “Many things cannot be effectively supervised, and the real corruption is under the table.”

;

;Some grassroots cadres are also worried about the durability and effectiveness of the policy. "I'm afraid that after a period of strict implementation, it will be loosened. (As time goes by) there are policies at the top and countermeasures at the bottom." Qian Hong said that even now, some problems have caused trouble for the eight-hour supervision.

;

;For example, he gave the example that some cadres would avoid places that are the focus of regulatory authorities and go to more private places; although there is community supervision, some cadres may have houses in several communities or even other urban areas; In terms of family supervision, some cadres have a bad relationship with husband and wife. They live their own lives and ignore each other; the power of social supervision is still weak.

;

;"In general, our means of actively grasping clues are not enough, and the efficiency of information screening is not high enough." As a colleague, Gan Keyi also feels the same way.

;

;In the view of Mao Zhaohui, director of the Anti-Corruption and Integrity Policy Research Center of Renmin University of China, eight-hour supervision can be a supervisory method to improve the conduct and discipline at the grassroots level, but it is limited by manpower, material resources, resources and means. It's not yet a regular job.

;

;Mao Zhaohui’s suggestion is, “If we want to achieve better results through eight-hour supervision, we should effectively introduce social supervision, including public opinion supervision and media supervision.”

;

;During the day from October 20 to 26, 2023, at the entrance of the Bengwan Theater in Xizha, Wuzhen, there was always a queue waiting to watch the show. The queue can sometimes stretch to the river. In September, free tickets for online reservations for the Wuzhen Theater Festival Youth Performance Competition (;hereinafter referred to as the "Youth Competition";) will be available at the beginning of the ticket sales It was robbed. This is one of the most important units of the Wuzhen Theater Festival every year, and it is also the only competition unit. Among the works of 18 groups of young dramatists, the Small Town Award for Best Drama, Best Individual Performance Award, and Special Attention Award will be determined.

;

;There is a sign in front of the fence outside the Bengwan Theater, indicating that ⅩⅩⅩ spectators can be admitted for this youth game. In the theater, the works of 18 groups of young dramatists were performed in turn; a screen was temporarily hung on a stone wall outside the theater for audiences who were unable to enter to watch the live broadcast. Under the scorching sun, there were always five or six rows of enthusiastic audiences sitting on the floor.

;

;Since 2013, the Wuzhen Theater Festival has been running for 10 years, and the Youth Competition has also been running for 10 years. Bengwan Theater is named after the earliest place name here. Huang Lei thinks it is good, "There are many clams in Bengwan, and each clam may hide a wonderful pearl."

;

;Wuzhen Theater Festival One of the initiators, actor Huang Lei, who has taught at the Beijing Film Academy for many years, has "deep gratitude" and "profound reflection on the shortcomings" of traditional art education. He brought some ideas that could not be implemented in school to the Wuzhen Theater Festival. This year, two days before the opening of the 10th Wuzhen Theater Festival, in a handwritten letter to the youth competition, Huang Lei wrote, "In the beginning, when the Wuzhen Theater Festival was just a small idea, young people were already fans of this festival. The protagonist, the origin and goal of everything is for the young people."

;

;The Youth Competition is open to young people who are interested in engaging in the theater industry. The rules are very simple: each of the three founders of the Wuzhen Theater Festival will bring a prop to form the group. The annual proposition - use these 3 props to rehearse an original play with no more than 5 people in 20-30 minutes.

;

;In May this year, Huang Lei, Lai Shengchuan, and Meng Jinghui, the founders of the Wuzhen Theater Festival, proposed the topic for the youth competition: world-famous paintings, train tickets, horses. "The fundamental purpose of the three props is not to test how you use the props, but to test how you use the environment, find effective stage fulcrums, and maximize the energy density of the play per unit time." Youth competition judge Li Bo said. In August, more than 500 works were submitted; in September, 18 groups of shortlisted works were announced; in mid-October, the group lottery for performances at the Wuzhen Theater Festival was released.

;

;The stage of Bengwan Theater is small and the layout is simple: ceiling light and curtain. The audience formed a semicircle, surrounding the stage.

;

;The small stage of Qingsai has produced many theater people over the years. In 2013, "Baba Mama" directed by Chen Minghao won the first prize. This year he is well-known to the public for his performance in "The Long Season"; in 2015, Wu Bi won the Best Drama Award for "Stillness". This year he is also a judge of the Youth Competition , is also an actor in Lai Shengchuan's new drama "Long Alley". Wu Bi once said that Wuzhen was the biggest turning point in his career. "You can have no cost and nothing, but you can do what you want to do and give everyone a stage for so many people to watch."

;

;;

;

;Wuzhen Theater Festival Youth Competition Unit Judge Li Bo;(provided by interviewee/picture);

;

;Li Bo participated in the first three Youth Competitions as a contestant, and his works all entered the top three. From the fourth time, he became one of the judges of the Youth Competition, responsible for selecting 18 groups of shortlisted works from hundreds of works; and then selected from the 18 groups. There will be 6 sets of final works.

;

;When he was in his early 20s, Li Bo studied in the Performance Department of Beijing Film Academy and enjoyed freedom and romance in the ivory tower. Later he became a university teacher. "I always felt that I had no goals and no outlet, so I was very confused." Participate The Wuzhen Theater Festival has directional significance for him. He said that it is a way for more people to understand his theatrical concepts.

;

;During the 10 days in Wuzhen, I spent a lot of time at the Bengwan Theater. From these youth plays, I can see the disappearance of love between men and women, the love between mother and daughter, and father and son. The hidden pain caused by the bondage, and the individual's reflection on the tearing of the world.

;

;The story of "Fifth Floor, Ninth Floor", which won the Best Drama Award, is set in a malfunctioning elevator. For half an hour, a boy on the fifth floor and a girl on the ninth floor reflect on their intimate relationship. , one feels that he is trapped by his boyfriend, and the other may be trapped by his girlfriend. They all wanted to run away and take imaginary train tickets to the north to see the auroras.

;

;;

;

;Stills of "Fifth Floor and Ninth Floor";(Provided by Wuzhen Theater Festival Organizing Committee/Photo);

;

;"Clam and Pearl" won the Special Attention Award and the Best Individual Performance Award. The protagonist is a very controlling mother. With the help of a psychologist, she reveals the trauma of being violated as a girl. At the end, the daughter takes a photo of her mother, and the mother looks back and turns into a picture of "Girl with a Pearl Earring."

;

;"Me and Liu Hongmei at the Station", which also won the Special Attention Award, has only one actor from beginning to end. "I" left the big city and returned to his hometown to become a staff member of the amusement park carousel project. We met several times. "She" (;grandma who has lived her whole life in her hometown;), when she was 15 years old, she wanted to secretly go swimming in the river; when she was in her twenties, She wanted to go to Beijing and Shanghai, and she cried anxiously when she lost her train ticket; she was 82 years old, thin, silent, and old, and time passed quickly on her; in the end, "I" took the 6-year-old "she" everywhere Carousel.

;

;;

;

;Still photo of "Liu Hongmei and I were at the Station";(Provided by Wuzhen Theater Festival Organizing Committee/Picture);

;

;One night during the drama festival, Li Bo queued up to watch Meng Jinghui's new play at the Zhenshui Carving Hall, and heard an audience member complain about a certain Qingsai play. Li Bo found it quite interesting. This just reflects the diversification of the youth competition standards. "It is true that the audience has mixed reviews of that play, but it is the only one-man show performed in this way on the youth competition stage in the past 10 years. We must encourage it, maybe in the future It will form a unique style. Young people should do a lot of exploration in their plays. If the plays are done very neatly, then it is Teacher Lai, right?"

;

;;

;

;This Youth Championship Finals The crew of the shortlisted work "Open the Unopenable Window" took their final bow;(Southern People Weekly reporter Zhang Yuxin/picture);

;

;After the finalists were announced and After the theater festival, Li Bo was interviewed twice by Southern People Weekly. The following is Li Bo's dictation:

;

;Qingsai is a school that allows you to have cute flaws

;

;;On October 26, we discussed the 6 shortlisted plays, and we wanted to take an official photo of the judges discussing the finalists. We all sat upright, holding the play review list. Later, someone came up with a point. Director Cheng Er was the first to stand up and said, no, this stage is so rare, this play must use the language of drama. Later, they all stood up and argued: what is reverence for the stage, what is the language of drama, how to perform in a small theater, how to use the three props, what to do if the performance times out...;< /p>;

;;There are more than 500 works registered, and we have to take care of a variety of themes, styles, and expressions. ;

;

;;Qing Sai is a school that allows you to have cute flaws. However, the dramas that were shortlisted for their flaws at the time were almost out of shape on the youth competition stage. ;

;

;;There is a play, the registration deadline is August 20th, I think they recorded it on August 19th , it’s too late if we don’t record it again. The video was taken at a piano store, and the first shot is still shaking. What they were performing was a light comedy, and the actors had to be absolutely relaxed. They probably acted as if they were not shortlisted. They came across a lot of spiritual and advanced comedy lines on the scene, so the ear guide team brought this up to the scene. . I was having a meeting out of town and was really bored, so I just put on headphones and watched the video. They were presented in a relaxed and playful way, and I was particularly happy to see them. The actor forgot his lyrics and laughed loudly, and so did I. ;

;

;;The finalists were announced later. The organizing committee called, signed the confirmation letter, designed the poster, and went to Wuzhen. Arrange three public rehearsals, an interview, a few more rehearsals, and then three rounds of performances. They began to realize that this was a competition and became nervous. When people are nervous, they become unfree. ;

;

;;The official Weibo announced the finalists, and there was a message saying that each of these six plays Solid, congratulations to them. This evaluation is the greatest encouragement for our work. Some plays may look good and rich, but they are too fluttery and tasteless at first glance; some may look steady, but the whole presentation has a poise that is rare for young people. ;

;

;;This year is the highest overall level I have seen in the 7 years I have been a judge. This year, we can really choose 6 out of the 6 finalists. In the end, we are making a choice. It happened that I came across a play that I liked very much, but some judges didn't like it very much, so the two of us kept arguing, but this was academic and not personal. When I work in an office, I tend to answer "yes" and "yes, you are right", but this problem does not exist at the Wuzhen Theater Festival. Teacher Lai and I also argued about it. ;

;

;;This year’s props are a horse, world-famous paintings, and train tickets. In addition to performance and text, the most important thing is to see how the three elements are used, because this game is supported by three elements. When we judge, if the performance of the two plays is similar, we will look at the props. Each of the three teachers was given a prop to prevent them from adapting old works. ;

;

;;The use of props particularly tests the professionalism of a crew. For example, we were fighting without a winner, and a knife suddenly appeared, and everyone wanted to grab it. This knife caused a turning point in the drama and changed the direction of the drama. This is a relatively common usage. ;

;

;;As for the props, I only mention it. This is the simplest; it also plays a role in the turning point of the play. Key role? Or is it an image and symbol that lingers in your mind throughout the play? These are three completely different levels. ;

;

;;The most difficult props this year are world-famous paintings, because we Chinese rarely have the experience of going to art exhibitions . Some of the plays are parodies of "Girl with a Pearl Earring", some have her family treating her works as world-famous paintings, and some have actors imitating "The Scream", all of which are quite cute. ;

;

;;"Liu Hongmei and I were at the Station", all of us judges passed the finals. I think its entry into the finals is inseparable from the use of props. The image of horses is present throughout. When we learn acting, whether props serve as the fulcrum of the stage or are key items that promote the development of the plot, they must appear on the stage, but they did not appear in this play. The script mentioned the carousel game. "I" walked around the stage like a merry-go-round and met "my" grandma. Every time I walked around, "I" saw Liu Hongmei in different stages. It all happened. Different things are related to Liu Hongmei's fate. Finally "I" returned to work and drove the merry-go-round for other children. So fresh, so natural. ;

;

;;

;

;The performance of "Then Tide, Sun, Moon" has ended;(Southern People Weekly reporter Zhang Yuxin/picture);

;

;Don’t be cool or showy, just focus on the story

;

;;I also said at the reading meeting that day that you can get chicken soup with 140 characters on Weibo, and you can achieve all your desires in one minute on TikTok. Why would someone waste two hours of their life in the theater to go to the theater? First of all, this play must have warmth. Second, the things you talk about in your play are things you don’t often see on Douyin, Kuaishou and Weibo. You need to lead the audience to pay attention to people in life that we have never paid attention to. ;

;

;;Up to now, I have selected one play in the previous youth competitions, and I think it is the best It is "Gama" in 2016 (Reporter's note: The title of the Youth Competition that year was A Drop of Blood, a Suitcase, and a Shooting Star. The protagonists of "Gama" are a mother and daughter. For many years, my mother has been unable to let go of leaving home to practice medicine. , the father who became a living Buddha, the living Buddha is dead, and the mother firmly believes that the living Buddha can be reincarnated and return home within 49 days, and hopes that her daughter Karma will be pregnant; but the child that Karma was pregnant with was the reincarnation of Kelsanghua, and the child also died. The mother The two women planned to go on their own pilgrimages and finally reconciled on the way to the sacred lake). Two graduate students from the Shanghai Theater Academy made it the only time in the history of the youth competition that the best individual performance award and the grand prize were all given to a team. When performing beliefs on the stage, they usually tend to be complicated, but that play was very simple, with one chair and two girls. One of the girls played two roles (the grandmother who never forgets her husband, and the reincarnated granddaughter of Kelsanghua). ), so simple yet so clear. After they kowtowed, they looked into the distance and saw a cold light coming over them. Wow, it was a lake. Tibetan music sounded, and it felt like we were in the snowy plateau. ;

;

;;From the first to the present, all the dramas that have won the grand prize are small and big. Talk about life down to earth. If you pick up a random person from Xizha, they can understand it even if they are over 10 years old or under 90 years old. ;

;

;;The stage of the youth competition is very close to the audience. Really, it is the most important thing. Is the core of your drama told to us through a small incident, or is it a fake philosophical event? I especially don't like to tell us something in a pretentious manner, or forcefully instill something. Including the judges' votes, the results of this kind of drama are not good. Young people's dramas don't need to be so complicated. Let's discuss To be or not to be. I'm sorry, you really don't have that skill. Sometimes what you think and what you perform are two different things. I still hope that the story can be told clearly: it has the story's ups and downs, characters, conflicts, and themes. Even if there is no intention, it is very rare. ;

;

;;Look at Liu Tianqi's "Chicken and Rabbit in the Same Cage" (Reporter's Note: Youth Competition Best Drama Award Award-winning work) How simple, the son went to prison to visit his father, and the two had a conversation. There is a big world in a small play. ;

;

;;I still think that young people don’t need to be cool or showy, they should be down-to-earth and focus their energy In terms of story, how to structure and unfold the story; the performance must be restrained. I especially hate the kind of badass performances that can be seen in short videos, but many people may be affected and feel that our scenes must be "acting". I told the contestants in the youth competition that it is the most difficult to act in a scene where the inner world is turbulent and the outer surface is as calm as water. When Marlon Brando, Robert De Niro, or Al Pacino encountered something that shattered his faith, was any one of them howling? His emotions are a reservoir, and as much as he wants can come out. ;

;

;;We also need to learn this on the stage. The performance must be subtle, restrained, and forbearing. Don't let the audience's shouts and applause make the play fly away and take over the show. Some plays were very popular, but we felt that they were a bit pleasing to the audience. After performing it once, we knew which baggage was in which place, but the second time we performed it with all our strength, without even control or rhythm. "Liu Hongmei and I were at the Station" is particularly stable and does not cater to the audience. ;

;

;;It is not easy to perform a one-man show. One person has to interpret many people. ;

;

;;We watched the registration video and there were a lot of one-man shows. A lot of it is like what we did when we were in school - a person encounters a dilemma within a unit of time, and through the struggle between people and the natural environment, the problem is pushed to a certain climax. But we should show new and real things to the audiences who come to Wuzhen. We have selected three one-man shows this time, such as "Liu Hongmei and I were at the Station", which are not one-man shows in the traditional sense. They are more often talking and revealing, in a particularly dull state, but the inner feelings are There is content. ;

;

;;I think the Bengwan Theater and Qingsai Theater in Wuzhen are an experimental field for young Chinese dramatists. As long as you have the ability, you can put your own experiments on the stage. The audience is tolerant, and so are our judges. ;

;

;;

;

;Outside the Bengwan Theater, posters of all the works of this youth competition are pasted on the gray stone wall;(South People Weekly reporter Zhang Yuxin/picture);

;

;If we don’t do drama, of course we can understand

;

;;When I was 33, 34, and 35 years old, I participated in the Youth Championship as a player. It was very unforgettable and worthwhile. In the first year, I did the only comedy among the 12 plays; in the second year, I did the only physical drama, without lines; in the third year, I did the only montage drama, relying on light to explain the performance. Now I am still a teacher, but I definitely can’t rule out things like those three years. People’s experiences are getting richer and their courage is getting smaller and smaller. Especially when working in a university, your imagination is not so wild. ;

;

;;In the first year of the Youth Voting Competition, we waited in line at school until two or three o'clock every night. The students were lined up to give up, saying that the standards of these judges must be high and they would not be shortlisted. I said, after being a teacher for so many years, I have also done scientific research and participated in awards. A competition that does not charge an entry fee must be a good competition. ;

;

;;I teach at a second public school, and students are recruited from the same school as Nortel Chinese Drama. There is a gap. The "survival rate" of my first class of students competing together is very high. One is in Happy Twist, one is in Dalian Repertory Theater, and one is now a delivery anchor. He is doing very well. I have seen his Live broadcast, his live broadcast skills are linked to his performance. He can hang up and smash up. Rather than watching his live broadcast, it is better to say that he is watching him perform a play. ;

;

;;I also rehearsed plays in college and Wuzhen plays. Sometimes one brain can be divided into two types ideas. All universities in China are actually the same, and university education has university characteristics. Therefore, when young people get the props from the Wuzhen Theater Festival, they may be very excited because they finally have the opportunity to make a comedy, tragedy or absurd play that they really like and have a sense of life. Let me put it in a very unpleasant light, Wuzhen's drama does not mean that after you perform in Wuzhen, you can perform it every day. If you win a grand prize in just 10 days, the chance of it being performed (continued) is very small. Some of the plays are very immature, but because the scenes are grand enough, they continue to be performed. ;

;

;;I still encourage young people to go to drama festivals to watch plays and compete. Drama lovers from all over the country come together in one place to talk about drama. This kind of preciousness is something that will linger in your mind for the rest of your life. ;

;

;;The goal of the Wuzhen Theater Festival is very clear. By capturing 5% of the people, this theater festival can manage. There is no way for us to have a chain of support like some film festivals, providing money to film, screen, and go online. Drama is still a niche, and the number of screens across the country is definitely much greater than the number of theaters. But we just want to give them a shot in the arm. Every year in the audience of the Wuzhen Youth Championship, there are contestants who were shortlisted in previous years. Those who did not vote this year, or who did not win, return to Wuzhen to watch the show. ;

;

;;Everyone has his or her own life choices. Of course we can understand if we don’t do drama, because It's good to be alive. If you're going to make a drama, make it a good one. ;

;On November 22, 2023, the official website of the Ministry of Education announced matters related to the 2024 National Master’s Degree Admissions Examination. According to statistics, the number of applicants for the national master's degree examination in 2024 is 4.38 million, a decrease of 360,000 or about 7.6% from the 4.74 million applicants for the postgraduate examination in 2023. This is also the first time in eight years that the number of applicants for the postgraduate examination has increased compared with the previous year. fall back.

;

;Why has the number of postgraduate entrance examinations declined? The outside world has summarized some possible reasons: some graduates turned to the public entrance examination, striving to get an iron job in one step, and withdrew from the postgraduate entrance examination track; some graduates no longer regard the postgraduate entrance examination as a choice, thinking that it is just a matter of paper. A postgraduate diploma may not necessarily lead to a good job, so it is better to enter the job market in advance to save opportunity costs; the postgraduate recruitment policies of major universities have changed. "The number of places for professional masters has increased and the number of places for academic masters has decreased", which has reduced the cost-effectiveness of postgraduate studies, and some prices Sensitive candidates give up in the face of high tuition fees.

;

;It is not difficult to see that these reasons all stem from the rational choices of candidates as "economic people": studying has increasingly become an investment, and the consumption attribute of higher education is also strengthening. If the candidates believe that studying for graduate school cannot improve the competitiveness of the job market and cannot bring good economic returns in the future, then the candidates will rationally consider "whether studying for graduate school is worth it", thereby reducing the "supply" of the higher education market. There is a rumor going viral that a famous postgraduate entrance examination teacher successfully predicted the decline in the number of people taking the postgraduate entrance examination. In fact, this also shows that his "preaching" over the years has achieved certain results.

;

;From a statistical point of view, the change in candidates' attitudes has also taken several years, which is essentially a "reverse incentive" brought about by changes in the job market. Statistics on the number of applicants for postgraduate entrance examinations over the years show that this number declined in 2014 and 2015, but has shown an upward trend since 2015, reaching a peak in 2023. The year-on-year expansion of postgraduate enrollment and the increase in the number of graduates have made the job market supply unable to keep up with the employment demand of graduates. This imbalance in supply and demand has naturally been transmitted to the upstream higher education market.

;

;It should be admitted that in reality, only a small proportion of people go to graduate school to satisfy their personal enthusiasm for knowledge or for scientific research. Most students go to graduate school for employment, which can be subdivided. Further studies to postpone employment, and "gold-plated graduate school" for better employment. Unfortunately, both of these options are facing great challenges amid a weak job market. Of course, students are not fools and will also adjust their life strategies according to social reality.

;

;The key factors that affect the supply and demand of the job market are the economic cycle and industrial structure. The feedback from the job market also determines the cost-effectiveness of graduate school. None of the three parties, students, employers, or universities, can answer the question of “is graduate school worth it” alone? In the face of sluggish demand in the job market, both employers and candidates have begun to take action to answer this question: companies have reduced the scale of school recruitment, while candidates have seen a decline in the number of applicants. What is worth asking is, how will universities respond?

;

;Since this century, the number of postgraduate students enrolled in China has increased year by year, from 220,000 in 2003 to more than 1 million in 2020, and now accounts for about 10% of undergraduate graduates that year. Major universities have expanded their enrollment of master's degree students so rapidly over the years. On the one hand, they are of course adapting to the growing needs of the job market. On the other hand, they can also apply for more funds for themselves, charge more tuition fees, and improve various evaluation indicators. In short, it is to strive for more benefits.

;

;In addition to the "reverse incentives" in the job market, the sluggish fertility rate is destined to continue to reduce the number of postgraduate entrance examinations in the future, and the phenomenon of "the merger of primary and secondary schools" will sooner or later spread to higher education. field, this will be a more decisive factor in the future than "candidates choose not to take the exam". In other words, the decline in the number of people taking postgraduate entrance examinations is an irreversible trend. In the future, colleges and universities may face a new enrollment gap of one million levels every year and have to face the severe situation of "competition for existing students". This is a serious issue that colleges and universities need to deal with urgently. challenge.

;

;"Reducing enrollment for master's degrees and expanding enrollment for associate's master's degrees" and "extending the academic system for associate's and master's degrees" are the response plans that some colleges and universities have come up with. In this way, they can not only maintain the original enrollment scale, but also increase enrollment. Collect tuition fees. But the question is, when colleges and universities make a fuss about the academic system and quota of associate and master's degrees, can they really "ensure the quality of training and improve employment competitiveness", or can they just "charge one more year of tuition" or even "delay one year"? "Employment" itself is quite debatable and deserves reflection. Some candidates' doubts about the cost-effectiveness of master's degrees may be one of the reasons for the decrease in the number of postgraduate students this year.

;

;According to the principles of organizational behavior, "organizations will work hard to create jobs for themselves, and employees of organizations will work hard to create jobs for each other." Since an organization has been established, it will do everything possible to maintain its existence, especially The public sector eats up financial resources. Public universities have long relied on taxpayers' money to operate and do not need to directly face market competition. Naturally, they will find ways to maintain their existing graduate spots.

;

;However, changes in supply and demand in the job market and the impact of declining fertility rates will be transmitted sooner or later. The arrival of the enrollment gap has become an irreversible trend. The decline in the number of postgraduate entrance examinations this year is a timely warning to major universities. Comply with the needs of the job market, comprehensively consider social needs, adjust the recruitment plan for graduate students, and better serve the public.
